intro: Solanum dioicum, commonly known as the nightshade or wild tomato, is a flowering plant in the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into berries containing several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Solanum dioicum is native to the Americas but has been introduced to various regions, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
